item.title: Filters and Bypasses - Rare IPv4 Formats for SSRF
item.description: Many applications these days do network requests on behalf of their users. For example, it is often possible to define webhooks, where users can specify URLs to which a server shall send HTTP requests when certain events occur. Other applications may allow uploading images by URL or they may generate PDFs from HTML rendered server-side, which could contain URLs (see here). In all these examples, users provide input to specify the destinations of server-side network requests.
